thread.title: Wildcats show no mercy to Dragons
thread.title_full: Wildcats show no mercy to Dragons

author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Wildcats show no mercy to Dragons
text: Wildcats show no mercy to Dragons by Travis Simpson The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:38 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 48 views | 0 | 0 | | HECTOR — The Wildcats held the undefeated Mountainburg Dragons — a team that, until Friday, averaged 49 points per game — to just two first downs in the first half of their 42-7 win at Linton Field."We played well," Hector head coach Mark Taylor understated.The Wildcats (6-0, 4-0 2A-4 Conference) scored on their first drive — 55 yards capped with a 2-yard keeper by Tanner Gaines. Hector scored next from seven yards out on a carry by Jacob Billingsley.Hector made it 21-0 at halftime on a 20-yard pass to Jalen Ferguson.Jaden Graham hauled in a 46-yard touchdown pass in the third quarter and Billingsly a 60-yard pass to make it 35-0. Mountainburg finally found an answer with a 37-yard pass to Jaden Carver to make it 35-7.Gaines thanked them with a 94-yard scoring run to set the final score.Taylor said he was most impressed with the defensive effort."Both these teams were 5-0," Taylor said, "I thought that our defense played outstanding. We came in and just absolutely didn't give up anything all night. I think our team showed a lot of maturity this week in how we prepared. That was the biggest thing I took away."Hector will host Union Christian on Friday.
